total_revenue.notes: Microsoft Cloud and AI strength drove the start of FY26

highlights: Azure and other cloud services +40% (39% CC)

Azure.notes: New data center investments, OpenAI deal and multi-workload adoption underpin growth

bookings.notes: Driven by Azure commitments (including OpenAI) and $100M+ contracts

rpo.notes: Weighted average duration ~2 years; ~35% recognized in next 12 months

capex.notes: Roughly half short-lived GPUs/CPUs, $11.1B finance leases; cash paid for PP&E $19.4B

infrastructure: Adding 80% more AI capacity this year, doubling footprint over two years, launching Fairwater (2GW) and GB300 clusters, and increasing token throughput for GPT-4.1/5 by 30%.
platform: Azure AI Foundry serves 80K customers with 11K models (including GPT-5, Grok 4); launched Microsoft Agent Framework, MAI models and Phi SLMs with 60M downloads.
copilots_agents: Copilot family reached 150M MAUs; introduced Agent Mode, Teams mode, App Builder; agent users doubled QoQ; GitHub Copilot now 26M+ users and launched Agent HQ.
security_health_consumer: Security Copilot now integrates Entra/Defender/Purview/Intune with 3 dozen agents; Dragon Copilot documented 17M patient encounters; Windows 11 Copilot fronted by wake word plus Copilot Mode in Edge; Xbox Ally launch records.
gaming_linkedin: Gaming reached 155M MAUs, 500M hours streaming, new titles like Keeper and Ninja Gaiden 4. LinkedIn nearly 1.3B members with double-digit growth and AI hiring tools.

segment_guidance.Productivity_and_Business_Processes: 33.3-33.6B (+13-14% CC); M365 Commercial cloud 13-14% CC; Consumer cloud mid-20s
segment_guidance.Intelligent_Cloud: 32.25-32.55B (+26-27% CC); Azure ~37% CC with continued capacity constraints
segment_guidance.More_Personal_Computing: 13.95-14.45B; Windows OEM/devices down mid-single digits; search low-double digits; Xbox content down low-mid single digits

outlook.capex: >30B driven by delivery timing and finance leases; FY26 growth rate higher than FY25
outlook.fx: Assuming current rates, +2 points to revenue growth, +1 point to COGS/opex; Microsoft Cloud GM ~66%.

metadata.source: Microsoft FY 2026 Q1 press release & transcript
